incidents.name: Retool Resources: Slack files.upload API Deprecation

incident_updates.body:
Slack is ending support for their files.upload API on March 11, 2025. 

You will now need to use the files.getUploadURLExternal and files.completeUploadExternal APIs to continue using upload functionality. Slack's changelog provides more information on this change as well as migration steps: https://api.slack-gov.com/changelog/2024-04-a-better-way-to-upload-files-is-here-to-stay

Our team is aware of this change and is working to update our Slack integration as quickly as possible. In the meantime, you should be able to use a REST Query to utilize the new APIs. https://docs.retool.com/queries/guides/api/rest

We apologize for any inconvenience and will keep you posted.

incidents.name: Slack incident impacting slack-based support services

incident_updates.body: The incident impacting the Slack Events API impacting accessibility of our Slack Support integration has been resolved from Slack's end, and full functionality has been restored.

A second slack incident may be impacting our Support offering via slack (available to Enterprise customers with Premium Support). Replies may be intermittent during the outage. Please leverage https://help.retool.com and support@retool.com as fallback contact channels in the meantime.

incidents.name: Slack downtime possibly impacting Retool support services

incident_updates.body: The slack incident has been resolved and Retool support via slack is now operational as normal.

Due to the ongoing slack api outage, our Support offering via slack (available to Enterprise customers with Premium Support) may be impacted. Replies may be intermittent during the outage. Please leverage https://help.retool.com and support@retool.com as fallback contact channels in the meantime.
We are currently investigating the impact of an on-going slack incident on our support services.
We're identified the root cause. The website should be back to normal now.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We're aware of the issue and are actively investigating.

incidents.name: Javascript custom libraries broken for workflows

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Adding new javascript custom libraries to workflows is currently broken. Existing workflows with custom libraries are still functional.

incidents.name: Investigating reports of performance degradation during peak traffic hours

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Investigation is under way for increased latencies during 6-9am PST hours for some customers. Further information will be shared once we verify a root cause. Components affected will be updated to reflect any ongoing performance degradations
This issue has been resolved
We are currently observing performance issues around loading apps in Retool Cloud.

incidents.name: Errors when deploying new versions of Retool apps with source control

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating "Unable to Deploy" errors when pushing new versions of Retool apps via source control.

components.name: Source Control
components.description: Source Control allows organizations to manage changes using source control management providers, such as GitHub, GitLab, AWS CodeCommit, Bitbucket, and Azure Repos. Provider outages can cause temporary Retool source control outages.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've identified an anomalous traffic pattern causing high response times, and our latency has recovered.
We're investigating high response times for some backend requests.

incidents.name: Issues running queries that used SSH tunnelling

incident_updates.body: 25% of resources that used SSH Tunneling were failing between 21:00 UTC and 22:45 UTC.
The configuration change has been rolled back and systems are stable. Incident is resolved at this time.
A configuration issue caused a networking outage that impacted critical retool components from 3:41 PST to 4:00 PST. Systems have recovered and we are actively monitoring.

We have received reports of Retool cloud accounts experiencing slow load times through the app from EU based users. We have confirmed all Retool infrastructure is operating normally, and have seen that using a US VPN currently seems the best way to work around such networking issues.

components.name: Infrastructure
components.description: Retool infrastructure runs on top of AWS. AWS outages can cause temporary Retool outages as well.

incidents.name: Query errors for script clients and some public apps

incident_updates.body: The fix has been deployed and resolution confirmed.

We have identified an issue causing non-browser clients (i.e. custom scripts) to be unable to make resource queries as well as a small percentage of public apps to fail to load. We have identified the cause and will deploy a fix shortly.

incidents.name: Elevated query latency and error rates

incident_updates.body:
Customers may have experienced elevated rates of 502's and significantly higher query latency on a subset of queries for a small period of time (12:50PM -> 2PM PST)

We've identified the cause and are continuing to monitor while rolling out a longer-term fix.

incidents.name: Chunk loading errors on self-hosted Retool instances

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Self-hosted deployments that are configured to automatically pull new Docker images may experience frontend chunk loading issues when some but not all containers are started / restarted. To fix these issues, please restart the remaining containers in the deployment.
Users on self-hosted Retool instances might experience interruptions on sending user invites
This incident has been resolved.

We have addressed an issue with our data cache and our monitors have returned to normal. Workflows runs were delayed and possibly failed if there were multiple scheduled runs of the same workflow between ~13:30 UTC and ~14:30 UTC.
We are investigating an issue with elevated error rates on our backend API, possibly data cache related.

We have applied a fix and are monitoring an issue where DNS resolution for AWS subdomains of *.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com were incorrectly resolving to private IP addresses.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We have applied a fix and are monitoring an issue where DNS resolution for some AWS (sub)domains were incorrectly resolving to private IP addresses.
